title: Nizar Qabbani
summary: Nizar Tawfiq Qabbani (Arabic: نزار توفيق قباني‎, ALA-LC: Nizār Tawfīq Qabbānī, French: Nizar Kabbani; 21 March 1923 – 30 April 1998) was a Syrian diplomat, poet, writer and publisher. His poetic style combines simplicity and elegance in exploring themes of love, eroticism, feminism, religion, and Arab nationalism. Qabbani is one of the most revered contemporary poets in the Arab world,[1][2] and is considered to be Syria's National Poet.[3]
